description: The $12 billion fraud trial of Vietnamese real estate tycoon Truong My Lan is scheduled to begin Tuesday as the government presses its anti-corruption campaign across all sectors of society.
title: Vietnam $12 Billion Fraud Trial to Begin Amid Anti-Graft Push

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal affairs correspondent Emily Birnbaum looks at what’s ahead for Donald Trump at the Supreme Court. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Gets Win at Supreme Court, But Bigger Decision Still Looms

description: Mark Cuban urged President Joe Biden to go further to rein in prescription drug costs, a key element of his reelection pitch, as he backed the incumbent ahead of a likely November rematch against Donald Trump.
title: Mark Cuban Backs Biden in 2024, Urging More Action on Drug Costs

description: The Biden administration asked the US Supreme Court to block a Texas law that would let the state arrest and deport people who enter the country illegally, adding another politically charged case to the court’s election year calendar.
title: Supreme Court Asked to Block Texas Migrant Deportation Law

description: The Philippines is reviving a push for companies to help fund infrastructure from airports to bus lanes now worth $43 billion, aiming to keep its luster as one of Asia’s growth stars amid limited fiscal space.
title: Asia’s Growth Star Woos Companies for Projects Worth $43 Billion

description: It’s a “killer moment” for the Conservatives if they want a chance at winning the election, Bloomberg government reporter Joe Mayes tells In the City.
title: Jeremy Hunt’s Make-or-Break UK Budget

description: The US government is working to increase the delivery of humanitarian aid to civilians in Gaza “through as many channels as possible,” including more airdrops, because “the situation is simply intolerable,” State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said.
title: US Says Airdrops to Gaza to Continue in ‘Intolerable’ Situation

description: Some of Germany’s allies are urging Berlin to tighten up security around classified information after Russia revealed sensitive discussions about aid for Ukraine, people familiar with the discussions said.
title: German Allies Tell Berlin to Tighten Security After Russian Leak

description: Mexico’s presidential candidate for the main opposition coalition, Xochitl Galvez, said Monday that she’s crunching numbers to determine whether to complete the project for an international Mexico City airport that was scrapped by Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador in favor of a military-built facility.
title: Mexico Opposition Leader Weighs Reviving Airport AMLO Shut Down

description: The United Nations has found “reasonable grounds” to conclude that Hamas committed sexual violence during its Oct. 7 attack in Israel, and said there are indications such violence continues to be carried out against those being held hostage by the group.
title: UN Finds Evidence of Sexual Violence by Hamas Since Oct. 7

description: A spending deal to keep the federal government operating through September would curb funding available to antitrust enforcers, potentially hindering high-profile investigations into Apple Inc. and Live Nation Entertainment Inc.’s Ticketmaster.
title: US Funding Deal Delivers Blow to DOJ Antitrust Probes of Apple, Ticketmaster

description: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif directed authorities to expedite negotiations with the International Monetary Fund on its Extended Fund Facility and to draft a strategy for economic recovery.
title: Pakistan’s Prime Minister Orders Starting Talks with IMF for Loan

description: Former President Donald Trump scored a crucial legal victory after the US Supreme Court overturned a decision by Colorado’s highest court that had removed him from 2024 ballots over his actions inciting the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.
title: Five Takeaways From Trump’s Supreme Court Win in Ballot Case

description: France will enshrine in its constitution a woman’s right to seek an abortion, a move that came in response to the curbing of access to the procedure in the US.
title: France Enshrines Right to Abortion in Nation’s Constitution

description: South Africa’s finance minister said introducing fiscal rules make sense, as stagnant economic growth due to incessant power cuts and logistical constraints are hindering efforts to rein in swelling debt.
title: South African Finance Chief Says New Rules Key to Mend Finances

description: Switzerland’s government sees no scope to block Swisscom AG’s plans to buy Vodafone Group Plc’s Italian business.
title: Switzerland Sees No Scope to Stop Swisscom Bid For Vodafone Unit

description: The US is sanctioning Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa and other top officials over what it called “gross abuses” following disputed elections.
title: US Sanctions Zimbabwe President Mnangagwa Over Human Rights

description: China charged the US with engaging in protectionist trade measures amid signs that Washington is prepared to step up efforts to keep Chinese electric vehicles from penetrating the American market.
title: China Calls Out US for ‘Classic Protectionism’ in Tension Over EVs

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is pushing to strengthen the labor rights of drivers for Uber Technologies Inc and similar passenger transport apps, taking on a challenge that has vexed lawmakers around the world.
title: Lula to Propose Stronger Labor Protections for Brazil’s Uber Drivers

description: Haiti declared a state of emergency and is imposing a nighttime curfew after heavily armed gangs raided the country’s two biggest prisons over the weekend and violence gripped the capital.
title: Violent Prison Break Sparks Kidnapping, Murder, Mayhem in Haiti

description: The US Supreme Court said Donald Trump can appear on presidential ballots this year, putting an end to efforts nationwide to ban him under a rarely used constitutional provision barring insurrectionists from holding office.
title: Supreme Court Rules Trump Can Appear on Presidential Ballots

description: Allen Weisselberg, the former chief financial officer of Donald Trump’s real estate company, pleaded guilty to perjury in connection with testimony he gave in New York state’s civil fraud case against the former president.
title: Ex-Trump CFO Weisselberg Pleads Guilty to Perjury in NY Case

description: The United Nation’s top nuclear official plans to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow as part of a sensitive diplomatic mission two years after the Kremlin’s seizure of Europe’s biggest atomic plant from Ukraine.
title: Russia to Host UN Nuclear Watchdog Two Years After Plant Seizure

description: France joined Poland and Estonia in calling on the European Union to mobilize “adequate” and “concrete” funding for defense programs and suggested an approach similar to what was used during the pandemic when joint bonds were deployed.
title: France Pushes EU for Financing Plan to Drive Defense Spending

description: Gustavo Petro’s bid to transform Colombia’s economic model has prompted a personnel crisis, with a stream of cabinet ministers and technocrats leaving their posts amid clashes with the president.
title: Petro Fires Droves of Investor-Friendly Technocrats in Colombia

description: President Joe Biden predicted his likely Republican opponent, Donald Trump, would seek to overturn the result if he lost the 2024 presidential election.
title: Biden Foresees Trump Challenging 2024 Election Defeat

description: Chile President Gabriel Boric’s disapproval rating rose at the end of February according to two new polls, highlighting the challenges facing his administration as it readies another push of its key reforms.
title: Chile’s President Stung by Rising Disapproval Ahead of New Reform Push

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party has recently approached UK business leaders across a range of sectors asking them to formally endorse the party ahead of a general election expected later this year, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Labour Asks UK CEOs to Sign Letters Endorsing Party at Election

description: Albania’s premier said NATO’s first air base in the country will help cement the Balkan region’s position within the Western military alliance and protect it from Russia’s “neo-imperial” ambitions.
title: Albania Warns of Russian Neo-Imperial Aims as NATO Airbase Opens

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Close to the Limits: Jeremy Hunt's Budget Dilemma

description: Germany said Vladimir Putin is trying to divide Ukraine’s allies with “absurd and disgraceful propaganda” following an intelligence leak that raised questions about the country’s vulnerability to espionage.
title: Germany in Damage Control After Russia Leaks Missile Talks

description: Israel delayed sending a high-level delegation to Cairo for talks on a cease-fire in the war against Hamas for a second day, putting a damper on hopes for an imminent deal.
title: Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Face Stand-off as Pressure Grows: Mideast Briefing

description: The US expressed alarm about continuing human-rights abuses in Ethiopia that may impact its ability to secure funding from multilateral lenders, as the International Monetary Fund prepares a mission to the country to discuss a crucial bailout.
title: US Raises Alarm Over Ethiopian Rights Abuses Before IMF Visit

description: Poland will call on the European Commission to impose a full ban on imports of food products from Russia and Belarus, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said.
title: Poland Pushes EU to Ban Food Imports from Russia and Belarus

description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will unveil a A$2 billion ($1.3 billion) financing facility as the centerpiece of a new package to drive Australian trade and investment in Southeast Asia, strengthening regional ties at a time of uncertainty over the US-China economic relationship.
title: Australia Pledges $1.3 Billion to Spur Southeast Asia Investment

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt is considering raising air passenger duty on business travel as a potential revenue-raising measure to help pay for personal tax cuts in the budget on Wednesday.
title: Hunt Prepares to Hike Business Air Travel Taxes to Fund Budget Giveaways

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: China Scraps Chance for Premier to Upstage Xi

description: Israel delayed sending a high-level delegation to Cairo for talks on a cease-fire in the war against Hamas for a second day, putting a damper on hopes for an imminent deal.
title: Gaza Cease-fire Talks Face Stand-off as Hunger and Pressure Grow

description: Thailand’s central bank faced renewed calls from the government camp to start easing monetary policy, with Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s top aide arguing that Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy needed cheaper borrowing costs to spur growth.
title: Thai PM Aide Renews Call for Interest-Rate Cuts to Aid Economy

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said his nation will pursue bilateral engagements with China to resolve their dispute in the South China Sea, even as he rebuked “aggression” in the contested waters and defended deepening ties with the US.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Says to Engage China, Rebukes ‘Aggression’

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government has pledged to boost manufacturing in India as it seeks a third term in power, potentially increasing the country’s control on supply chains and creating jobs, a government adviser said.
title: Modi Will Lift Trade, Manufacturing in Third Term, Adviser Says

description: Americans across the political spectrum have less favorable opinions of both Israel and the Palestinian Authority after the onset of the Israeli-Hamas war last year, a Gallup survey found.
title: Americans Sour on Both Israel and Palestinian Authority in Poll

description: Li Qiang will become the first Chinese premier in three decades to skip a press briefing at the annual legislative meeting, a move likely to fan investor fears about opaque policymaking.
title: China Cuts Premier Briefing; GDP Target Upcoming: NPC Highlights

description: Former Thai prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra was acquitted in a case related to her role in spending 240 million baht ($6.7 million) to publicize her then government’s infrastructure projects.
title: Thai Court Acquits Thaksin’s Exiled Sister for PR Projects

description: The Netherlands has closed its consulate in the southwestern megacity of Chongqing, a move that comes as China struggles to attract foreign investors.
title: Netherlands Shuts a China Consulate as Foreign Investment Slumps

description: A senior Singaporean official took to social media to defend US Ambassador Jonathan Kaplan after an internal watchdog in Washington reported the envoy had threatened staff and poorly promoted American interests in the city-state.
title: Singapore Minister Sticks Up for US Envoy After Scathing Report

description: Hard-liners consolidated control over Iran’s parliament in elections that saw voter turnout fall to record lows.
title: Iran Hard-Liners Tighten Parliament Grip as Turnout Hits New Low

description: The World Trade Organization’s ability to tear down barriers to commerce, ensure stability through global accords and enforce the rules came under renewed criticism following a chaotic and contentious meeting of its top officials.
title: Fractures in Global Trade Deepen as WTO Musters Only a Small Win

description: Tens of thousands of farmers will be using public transport to reach India’s capital on Wednesday, after weeks-long protests were stymied by blockages on highways, in the growers’ latest attempt to dial up pressure on the government to meet their demands.
title: Indian Farmers Announce a New Wave of Protests Ahead of Polls

description: China indicated its legislature will refrain from announcing any personnel moves during its meeting this week, meaning Wang Yi will likely remain in the role for at least the near future.
title: China Signals Legislature Will Avoid Naming Foreign Minister

description: John Roberts is the founder and chief executive officer of AO World, the online electrical goods retailer. AO World is listed on the London Stock Exchange and made sales of £1.2 billion ($1.5 billion) in the year through March 2023.
title: Tory Tax Cuts Would Be Irresponsible, Says AO World Boss

description: China’s Premier Li Qiang will not hold a press briefing at the end of the National People’s Congress, breaking a long-standing political tradition and fanning fears about diminishing access to information.
title: China to Skip Tradition of Premier’s Press Briefing at NPC

description: Nikki Haley won the Republican primary in the District of Columbia Sunday, giving her the first victory in the nominating contests of 2024 and slowing Donald Trump’s march to the Republican nomination.
title: Haley Gets First Primary Win in D.C. With Super Tuesday Ahead

description: The US and South Korea started one of their largest annual joint military drills in a move certain to raise tempers in North Korea, which began the year by threatening to destroy its neighbor to the south.
title: US, South Korea Start Military Drills Set to Anger Kim Jong Un

description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Nikki Haley has won the Republican primary in the District of Columbia, notching her first victory of the 2024 campaign.
title: Nikki Haley Wins First Republican Primary in Washington, DC

description: Mexico presidential front runner Claudia Sheinbaum said pensions won’t be at risk of disappearing or being altered in her government.
title: Mexico Candidate Sheinbaum Says Pensions Aren’t in Danger

description: South Korea plans to start legal proceedings that could lead to punishments for doctors who have walked off the job and disrupted health care to protest a plan to increase medical school enrollment.
title: South Korea to Start Legal Steps to Punish Doctors in Walkout
